programme.desc: Action from the second day's play at the All England Club, where the first round in the men's and ladies' singles was set to continue.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2016 - Live
programme.desc: Coverage of the third day's play at the All England Club, with the men's and ladies' singles second-round matches scheduled to fill the famous grass courts. British star Heather Watson enjoyed one of the most significant victories of her career here in round two last year as she defeated Daniela Hantuchova in straight sets, which set up a thrilling last-32 clash against Serena Williams. The world number one lost just five games in her win over Timea Babos, but seventh seed Ana Ivanovic was not so fortunate, as she tumbled out of the tournament with a straight-sets loss to American qualifier Bethanie Mattek-Sands. Marin Cilic, one of the dark horses to win the title, almost followed Ivanovic out of the competition, but eventually found just enough to beat Ricardas Berankis in a five-set thriller on Centre Court.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2016 - Live
programme.desc: Coverage from the All England Club, as day four of the third Grand Slam tournament of the year gets under way, featuring the men's and ladies' second-round matches. While most of the seeded players enjoyed comfortable passages to round three on this day last year, former champion Rafael Nadal continued his poor recent run in the tournament, having failed to make it past round four since 2011. The Spaniard lost in four sets to qualifier Dustin Brown and is missing this time as his troublesome wrist continues to hamper his chances of attaining full fitness. Roger Federer played on Centre Court in the match preceding Nadal's last year, and strolled to a 6-4, 6-2, 6-2 victory against Sam Querrey, and Petra Kvitova continued the defence of her title with a straightforward win over Kurumi Nara.(n)
